alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 4:01PM MDT until August 14 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 401 PM MDT, Doppler radar estimates rainfall amounts of between around 0.5 to 1.5 inches from earlier thunderstorms in Zion National Park, particularly over areas near Pine Creek, Lower Clear Creek, Shelf Canyon, and Spry Canyon. Zion National Park Rangers reported multiple waterfalls through the affected area, the largest of which was reported in the Twin Brothers area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, dry washes, creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park and Springdale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
